tit.e: Danjiri (decorative portable shrine, float used in festivals)

sen.j: 地車（だんじり・だんぢり）は、神社の祭で用いられる山車・だんじりの一種。
sen.e: Danjiri is a type of dashi (float) or danjiri used at shrine festivals.

sen.j: 大小2つに分かれた独特の破風屋根を持つ曳き山で、彫刻の装飾が施されている。
sen.e: It is a float with decorative carvings all around it and a unique form of gabled roof that is split into a small one and a large one.

sen.j: 地車祭り
sen.e: Danjiri Matsuri (danjiri festivals)
Danjiri Matsuri (danjiri festivals)

sen.j: 地車と呼ばれる山車を曳く祭り、地車囃子の演奏を奉納する祭礼の総称である。
sen.e: This is a general term for festivals in which a dashi called danjiri is pulled, or for rites and festivals in which a performance of danjiri bayashi (music performed at festivals) is dedicated.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉による大坂城築城の際、地車囃子が「テーマソング」になったとされている。
sen.e: It is considered that when Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI built Osaka-jo Castle danjiri bayashi music became its 'theme song.'

sen.j: もちろん、築城も古墳造営と同じく大規模な土木工事なので、修羅が用いられている。
sen.e: Of course, building of a castle is a large-scale construction project just like building of a tumulus, and therefore timber chutes were used.

sen.j: 地車、および囃子が摂津国、すでにその周辺地域に定着していたとしてもよかろう（築城は畿内以外でもなされているので、この考えに矛盾点もある）。
sen.e: It can be considered that danjiri and hayashi (Japanese music played to keep measure or enliven the mood) were already established in Settsu Province and its vicinity (castles were being built in areas outside of Kinai region (provinces surrounding Kyoto and Nara), and therefore, there is an inconsistency in this view).

sen.e: Furthermore, there is a record that danjiri's miyairi (ending of a festival by bringing portable shrines or floats back to the shrine) began at Osaka Tenman-gu Shrine during the Kanei era, which was the era of the Third Seiitaishogun (literally, 'great general who subdues the barbarians') Iemitsu TOKUGAWA.

sen.j: 織豊時代の囃子が継承されていたと考えられる。
sen.e: It can be considered that the hayashi music of the Shokuho era (Oda-Toyotomi era) had been passed down.

sen.j: このような説に従えば、ヨーロッパのクラシック音楽（バロック音楽）と呼ばれているものよりも、僅差ではあるが古いということになる。

sen.j: もっとも、ヨーロッパの場合、楽譜というものが存在したが、日本の前近代の音楽には、楽譜が存在しない。
sen.e: Of course, musical scores existed in the case of Europe, but no such scores existed in pre-modern Japanese music.

sen.j: 地車の型
sen.e: Forms of Danjiri

sen.j: 地車の型は大きく「下地車（下だんじり）」「上地車（上だんじり）」の2つに大別できる。
sen.e: The form of danjiri can be divided into two main groups of 'shimo danjiri' and 'kami danjiri.'
The form of danjiri can be divided into two main groups of 'shimo danjiri' and 'kami danjiri.'

sen.j: 「下」「上」とはだんじりの重心が「下」にあるか、「上」にあるかという意味である。
sen.e: 'Shimo' (lower) and 'kami' (upper) indicate whether the center of gravity of danjiri is located 'below' or 'above.'

sen.j: また、岸和田旧市の北町が泉大津より地車を購入し曳き方に合わせ改良を重ねた物が現在の下地車と呼ばれる物である。
sen.e: The danjiri that is currently called shimo danjiri has been continuously improved according to the way it was pulled, since Kitamachi, a former city in Kishiwada, purchased it from Izumiotsu.

sen.j: この事から南へ下った所でそれまでと違う形のだんじりが出来たそれを下地車と呼び対して従来の形のものを上地車と呼ぶようになったと言う説もある。
sen.e: From this, in the areas further south, danjiri was created in a form that was different from the conventional form, and according to one view, this type of danjiri is called shimo danjiri as opposed to the traditional form which is called kami danjiri.

sen.j: 後部にやりまわしや方向転換に使用する後梃子があり、大屋根に鳥衾と呼ばれる3本の角がついている。

sen.j: 上地車（かみダンジリ）
sen.e: Kami danjiri

sen.j: 大阪府泉州地域以外はほとんどがこの上地車である。
sen.e: Other than the ones in Senshu Region of Osaka Prefecture, most are kami danjiri.

sen.j: 上地車は、地域によりその形態に特徴があり、住吉型（大佐だんじり）・堺型・大阪型・石川型（仁輪加だんじり）・北河内型・大和型・神戸型・尼崎型・舟型・社殿型・宝塚型というように多種多様な型が存在する。
sen.e: Unique features can be found in the form of kami danjiri depending on the region, and various types exist, such as Sumiyoshi form (Taisa danjiri), Sakai form, Osaka form, Ishikawa form (Niwaka danjiri), Kawachi form, Yamato form, Kobe form, Amagasaki form, Fune (ship or boat) form, Shaden (Shinto-shrine) form and Takarazuka form.

sen.j: 重量は比較的軽く、上り坂でも進むことができる。

sen.j: 下地車にある前梃子は無く、周りを「担い棒」と呼ばれる木の梁で囲っているのが特徴。
sen.e: There is no front lever, which is found in shimo danjiri, and it features wooden beams called 'ninaibo' (shoulder carrying poles) that surround it.

sen.j: この担い棒があるため、「連合曳き」と呼ばれるパレードの際に、地車を担ぎ上げて「ウィリー」させることができる。
sen.e: Because of these carrying poles it can be 'wheelied,' known as 'rengo biki,' by raising the danjiri during a parade.

sen.j: これを「差し上げ」と言い、これは上地車を使う、南部大阪のほとんどの地域で行われている。
sen.e: This is called 'sashiage' (lifting up, raising,) and this is performed in most regions in southern Osaka that uses kami danjiri.

sen.j: そのほか、横に揺らす「横しゃくり」や、梃子の原理を用いて「地車(ダンジリ)」を前後に揺らす「縦しゃくり」を行ったり、前後に走らせたりする。

sen.j: よって、大阪天満宮からみて今福・蒲生が東に位置しており同神社で奉納されているので「ヒガシ」が天満流、天満宮からみて長柄が北に位置するので「キタ」が長柄流と呼ばれてきたらしい。
sen.e: Therefore, it seems that 'higashi' is called the Tenma ryu because Imafuku and Gamo are located to the east of Osaka Tenman-gu Shrine and the performance was dedicated at this shrine, and 'kita' is called the Nagara ryu because Nagara is located to the north of Tenman-gu Shrine.

sen.j: これが踊りの代名詞的なものになっているのは、大阪天満宮の天神祭（日本三大祭の一つ）のときに境内で奉納されているので、マスコミに露出する頻度が高く、こうして広まったからであろう。
sen.e: The reason why this has become a synonym for the dance is that because the dance is dedicated at Tenjin Matsuri (one of the Three Great Festivals in Japan) in the precincts of Osaka Tenman-gu Shrine, and it is often exposed through the mass media, which has led to its spread.

sen.e: Unlike Edo, which was a city mainly of samurai, Osaka is a city of merchants.
Unlike Edo, which was a city mainly of samurai, Osaka is a city of merchants.

sen.j: したがって、処刑を意味する「手打ち」という語を忌避したとは考えられ難い。
sen.e: Therefore, it is hard to think that the word 'teuchi,' which implies execution, incurred a sense of avoidance.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, it is hard to think that the word 'teuchi,' which implies execution, incurred a sense of avoidance.
Therefore, it is hard to think that the word 'teuchi,' which implies execution, incurred a sense of avoidance.

sen.j: やはり、そのままで手打ちとするのが妥当であろう。
sen.e: Therefore, it is appropriate to call it as teuchi.
Therefore, it is appropriate to call it teuchi.
Therefore, it is appropriate to call it teuchi.

sen.j: 商談成立も手打ちである。
sen.e: Teuchi is also used when business arrangements are completed.
Teuchi is also used when business arrangements are completed.
Teuchi is also used when business arrangements are completed.

sen.j: また、芸人は文化の伝承を無視する傾向が強く「平気で三本締めをやる東京本社の吉本興業など無知な会社に所属する」などと批判される。
sen.e: There is a criticism such as, 'Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. that has its head office in Tokyo belong to a group of ignorant companies' because entertainers have a strong tendency to ignore cultural traditions.

There is a criticism such as, 'Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. that has its head office in Tokyo belongs to a group of ignorant companies' because entertainers have a strong tendency to ignore cultural traditions.
sen.cmt: 複数形を単数形に訂正しました。
sen.e: There is a criticism such as, 'Yoshimoto Kogyo Co., Ltd. that has its head office in Tokyo belongs to a group of ignorant companies' because entertainers have a strong tendency to ignore cultural traditions.

sen.j: 手打ちの種類
sen.e: Types of Teuchi
Types of Teuchi
Types of Teuchi

sen.j: 手打ちを標榜している地車のほとんどは、「『打ーちましょ』ドンドン、『も一つせ』ドンドン、『祝ぉて三度』ドドンがドン、」とする。
sen.e: Most of danjiri that advocate teuchi perform '"u chimasho" (let's clap) don, don, "mohitotsu se" (do another one) don, don, "iwo te sando" (celebrate three times) dodon ga don.'
Most of danjiri that advocate teuchi perform '"u chimasho" (let's clap) don, don, "mohitotsu se" (do another one) don, don, "iwo te sando" (celebrate three times) dodon ga don.'
Most of danjiri that advocate teuchi perform '"u chimasho" (let's clap) don, don, "mohitotsu se" (do another one) don, don, "iwo te sando" (celebrate three times) dodon ga don.'

sen.j: 地車同士が陸（おか）や船ですれ違うときには、「『打ちまーひょ』ドンドン、『も一つせぇい』ドンドン、『よーいとさ』ドンすっトントン」とする。
sen.e: When the danjiri floats pass each other on a hill or on boats they perform '"uchima hyo' don, don, 'mohitotsu se ei' (do another one) don, don, and "yo itosa' don sutton ton.'
When the danjiri floats pass each other on a hill or on boats they perform '"uchima hyo' don, don, 'mohitotsu se ei' (do another one) don, don, and "yo itosa' don sutton ton.'
When the danjiri floats pass each other on a hill or on boats they perform '"uchima hyo' don, don, 'mohitotsu se ei' (do another one) don, don, and "yo itosa' don sutton ton.'

sen.j: このように、一般向けと、地車用の手打ちが存在する。
sen.e: Thus, there exist teuchi for the general public and teuchi specifically for danjiri.
Thus, there exist teuchi for the general public and teuchi specifically for danjiri.
Thus, there exist teuchi for the general public and teuchi specifically for danjiri.

sen.j: 一方で、マスコミや芸人は、「『打ーちましょう（『打ちまーひょ』とせず、最初を伸ばす） または『締ーめましょ』ドンドン、『も一つせぇい』ドンドン、『祝ぉて三度』ドドンがドン」としているようだが、こちらは地車の手打ちとは別物として扱うべきであろう。
sen.e: On the other hand, it seems that the mass media and entertainers say '"u chimasho (not "uchima hyo," the beginning part is made long) or "shi memasho" don, don, "mohitotsu se ei" don, don, "iwo te sando" dodon ga don,' but these should be treated as something that are different from the danjiri teuchi.

On the other hand, it seems that the mass media and entertainers say '"u chimasho (not "uchima hyo," the beginning part is made long) or "shi memasho" don, don, "mohitotsu se ei" don, don, "iwo te sando" dodon ga don,' but these should be treated as something that are different from the danjiri teuchi.

On the other hand, it seems that the mass media and entertainers say '"u chimasho (not "uchima hyo," the beginning part is made long) or "shi memasho" don, don, "mohitotsu se ei" don, don, "iwo te sando" dodon ga don,' but these should be treated as something that are different from the danjiri teuchi.

sen.j: 上方落語協会の定席・天満天神繁昌亭のこけら落としであった2006年9月15日、天満宮境内にて、地車講と噺家（落語家）とが手打ちをおこなった。
sen.e: On September 15, 2006, which was the opening of the new Tenman Tenjin Hanjotei Theater, a Joseki (theater for regularly scheduled performances) of Kamigata Rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) Association, the danjiri association and the hanashika (professional rakugo story teller) (rakugo story teller) did a teuchi at the Tenman-gu Shrine precincts.

On September 15, 2006, which was the opening of the new Tenman Tenjin Hanjotei Theater, a Joseki (theater for regularly scheduled performances) of Kamigata Rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) Association, the danjiri association and the hanashika (professional rakugo story teller) (rakugo story teller) did a teuchi at the Tenman-gu Shrine precincts.

On September 15, 2006, which was the opening of the new Tenman Tenjin Hanjotei Theater, a Joseki (theater for regularly scheduled performances) of Kamigata Rakugo (traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region) Association, the danjiri association and the hanashika (professional rakugo story teller) (rakugo story teller) did a teuchi at the Tenman-gu Shrine precincts.

sen.j: その際、噺家が「...（略）『祝ぉて三度』ドドンがドン」とやろうとしたのに対して、地車講は平然と「...（略）『よーいとさ』ドンすっトントン」と囃した。
sen.e: On this occasion, as opposed to the hanashika who was about to do '(abbreviated) "iwo te sando" dodon ga don' the danjiri association nonchalantly took the rhythm of '(abbreviated) "yo itosa" don sutton ton.'

On this occasion, as opposed to the hanashika who was about to do '(abbreviated) "iwo te sando" dodon ga don' the danjiri association nonchalantly took the rhythm of '(abbreviated) "yo itosa" don sutton ton.'

On this occasion, as opposed to the hanashika who was about to do '(abbreviated) "iwo te sando" dodon ga don' the danjiri association nonchalantly took the rhythm of '(abbreviated) "yo itosa" don sutton ton.'

sen.j: やはり、芸人の「大阪締め」と、地車の「手打ち」とは別物であった。
sen.e: It proves that the 'Osaka jime' of entertainers is completely different from the 'teuchi' of danjiri.
It proves that the 'Osaka jime' of entertainers is completely different from the 'teuchi' of danjiri.
It proves that the 'Osaka jime' of entertainers is completely different from the 'teuchi' of danjiri.
